revisions.rev:
This is a '''list of live CDs'''. A live CD or live DVD is a CD or DVD containing a bootable computer operating system. Live CDs are unique in that they have the ability to run a complete, modern operating system on a computer lacking mutable secondary storage, such as a hard disk drive.
== Rescue and repair live CDs == *[[Billix]] â a multiboot distribution and system administration toolkit with the ability to install any of the included Linux distributions *[http://www.bootmed.com BootMed] â a Live CD that was made to help those not familiar with Linux, repair or recover their Windows Computer from a Live CD. *[[Inquisitor (hardware testing software)|Inquisitor]] â Linux-based hardware diagnostics, stress testing and benchmarking Live CD *[[Parted Magic]], entirely based on the 2.6 or newer kernels. *[[Recovery Is Possible|RIP: (R)ecovery (I)s (P)ossible]] is a Linux-based CD with partition tool and network tools ([[Samba (software)|Samba]]), earlier versions were based on the 2.6.17 kernel. *[[System Folder]] of [[Mac OS]] on a [[Compact Disc|CD]] or on a [[floppy disk]] â works on any media readable by [[68k]] or [[PowerPC]] Macintosh computers. *[[SystemRescueCD]] is a Linux-based CD with tools for Windows and Linux repairs, based on the 2.6 kernel. *[[Trinity Rescue Kit]] â Mandriva Linux-based CD for use on a Windows or Linux-based system.
== BSD-based == === [[OpenBSD]] based === * [[Anonym.OS]] â an [[OpenBSD]]-based disk for secure anonymous web browsing * BSDanywhere [http://bsdanywhere.org/] * jggimi [http://jggimi.homeip.net/livecd/downloads.html] - a set of [[LiveCD]]s * OliveBSD [http://g.paderni.free.fr/olivebsd/] * MarBSD[http://openbsd.maroufi.net/download_en.shtml] * OpenBSD Live-CD Firewall [http://www.alti.at/knowhow/obsdlivecd/fw.php]
=== [[FreeBSD]] based === * [[DesktopBSD]] â as of 1.6RC1{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}} FreeBSD and FreeSBIE based * [[FreeBSD]] â has supported use of a "fixit" CD for diagnostics since 1996 * [[FreeNAS]] â m0n0wall-based * [[FreeSBIE]] â [[FreeBSD]]-based * [[Ging (live CD)|Ging]] â [[Debian GNU/kFreeBSD]]-based * [[m0n0wall]] â FreeBSD-based * [[pfSense]] â m0n0wall-based * [[GhostBSD]] - FreeBSD based with gnome gui, installable to HDD.
=== [[NetBSD]] based === * [[Jibbed]] â NetBSD-based
=== Other BSDs === * [[DragonFly BSD]]
== Linux-based == {{See also|Comparison of Linux distributions#Live CDs/DVDs/USBs}}
=== Debian-based === These are directly based on Debian:
*[[Debian Live]] - Official live CD version of Debian. *[[aptosid]]<ref>[http://aptosid.com aptosid.com :: debian based live CD development]</ref> based on Debian unstable (Sid), installable Live CD, DVD *[[Finnix]] â a small system administration Live CD, based on Debian testing, and available for x86 and PowerPC architectures *[[grml]] â installable Live CD for sysadmins and text tool users *[[Knoppix]] â the "original" Debian-based Live CD *[[PureOS]] - based on Debian testing, installable Live CD/USB
==== Knoppix-based ==== ''A large number of live CDs are based on Knoppix. The list of those is in the [[Knoppix#Derivatives|derivatives section of the Knoppix article]].''
==== Ubuntu-based ==== These are based at least partially on [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], which is based on Debian: [[gNewSense]] â supported by the [[Free Software Foundation]], includes [[GNOME]] *[[gOS (operating system)|gOS]] â a series of lightweight [[operating systems]] based on Ubuntu with [[Ajax (programming)|Ajax]]-based [[List of Google products|applications]] and other Web 2.0 applications, geared to beginning users, installable Live CD *[[Linux Mint]] â installable Live CD *[[Mythbuntu]] â a self-contained [[Home theater PC|media center]] suite based on [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] and [[MythTV]] *[[OpenGEU]] â installable Live CD *[[PC/OS]] â A Ubuntu derivative whose interface was made to look like BeOS.[22] a 64 bit version was released in May 2009.[23] In 2010 PC/OS moved to a more unified look to its parent distribution and a GNOME version was released on March 3, 2010. *[[Puredyne]] - live CD/DVD/USB for media artists and designers, based on Ubuntu and Debian Live. *[[Satanic Ubuntu Undead CD]] - live CD with free music and other "Satanic" goodies based on Ubuntu "christian edition" *[[Qimo 4 Kids]] â A fun distro for kids that comes with educational games *[[Super OS|Super OS (formerly Super Ubuntu)]] â installable Live DVD, can be converted to a [[Live USB]] using the built-in [[cd2usb]] or [[usb-creator]] *[[TurnKey Linux Virtual Appliance Library]] â family of installable Live CD appliances optimized for ease of use in server-type usage scenarios *[[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], [[Kubuntu]], [[Lubuntu]], [[Xubuntu]] â installable Live CDs, also known as the desktop installer<ref name="ubuntu">{{cite web |url=https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/FromLinux |accessdate=2009-11-12 |title=Installation/FromLinux - Community Ubuntu Documentation |publisher=Canonical Ltd.}}</ref> *[[CGAL]] LiveCD â live CD containing CGAL with all demos compiled. This enables the user to get an impression of CGAL and create CGAL software without the need to install CGAL.<ref name="cgal">{{cite web |url=http://acg.cs.tau.ac.il/cgal-at-tau/cgal-livecd/cgal-livecd|accessdate=2010-01-01|title=CGAL LiveCD|publisher=ACG lab, Tel-Aviv University}}</ref> *[[elementary OS]] â installable Live CD
==== Other ==== *[[CrunchBang Linux]] â installable Live CD, using [[Openbox]] as [[window manager]] *[[Damn Small Linux]] â very light and small with [[JWM]] and [[fluxbox]], installable Live CD *[[DemoLinux]] (versions 2 and 3) â one of the very first Live CDs *[[Dreamlinux]] â installable Live CD to hard drives or flash media *[[Freeduc-cd]] â an educational live CD using [[Xfce]] realized with the help of [[UNESCO]] *[[gnuLinEx]] â includes [[GNOME]] *[[GNUstep#GNUSTEP_live_CD_/_USB_image|GNUstep]] â works on i386, AMD64, UltraSPARC, and PowerPC *[[Kanotix]] â installable Live CD *[[MEPIS]] â installable Live CD *[[Slax]] â a [[Slackware]] derivative, modular and very easy to remaster
=== Gentoo-based === *[[FireballISO]] â VMware [[virtual machine]] that generates a customized security-hardened [[IPv4]] and [[IPv6]] [[Firewall (computing)|firewall]] Live CD. *[[iloog]] *[[Incognito (Linux)|Incognito]] â includes anonymity and security tools such as [[Tor (anonymity network)|Tor]] by default *[[Kororaa]] *[[Pentoo]] *[[SabayonLinux]] *[[SystemRescueCD]] *[[VidaLinux]] *[[Ututo]]
=== tgz or txz -Slackware-based === *[[AUSTRUMI]] â 50 MB Mini distro *[[BackTrack]] â a penetration testing toolkit. (version 5 R1 now out, and is based in Ubuntu with KDE or Gnome in both 32 and 64 bit.) *[[BioSLAX]] - a bioinformatics live CD with over 300 bioinformatics applications *[[NimbleX]] â under 200 MB *[[Porteus (operating system)]] â under 300 MB *[[Salix OS|Salix]] *[[SLAMPP]] *[[STUX]] *[[Vector Linux]] (Standard and SOHO Editions) *[[Zenwalk]]
=== rpm-based === ==== Mandriva-based ==== *[[DemoLinux]] (version 1) *[[Mandriva Linux]] â installable Live CD, [[GNOME]] and [[KDE]] editions available *[[MCNLive]] â mid-sized (300 MB) and for multimedia
==== openSUSE-based ==== *[[openSuSE]] â official Novell/SuSE-GmbH version - installable Live CD [[GNOME]] and [[KDE]] versions available *[http://susegallery.com/a/PbtTyk/mangoes--3 Linux MangOeS] - Live CD based on e17 and openSuSE *[http://susegallery.com/a/FbDcLt/smeegol Smeegol] - Live CD with [[MeeGo]] based on openSUSE *[http://getchrome.eu/ Chrome OS Linux] - Live CD built around [[Google Chrome]] browser
====Red Hat Linux/Fedora-based==== *[[Berry Linux]] *[[CentOS]] â installable Live CD *[[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]] â installable Live CD, [[GNOME]] or [[KDE]] *[[Network Security Toolkit]] â installable Live CD/DVD, [[GNOME]] or [[Fluxbox]]
====Other==== *[[Granular Linux|Granular]] â installable Live CD based on PCLinuxOS, featuring KDE and Enlightenment *[[PCLinuxOS]] â installable Live CD for desktop computing use
=== Other (Linux-based) === *[[Acronis Rescue Media]] â to make disk images from [[hard disk drive]]s *[[Arch Linux]] - a live CD targeted at experienced Linux users. *[[Archie (Linux)|Archie]] is a live CD version of [[Arch Linux]]. *[[CHAOS (Linux distribution)|CHAOS]] â small (6 [[Megabyte|MB]]) and designed for creating ad hoc [[computer cluster]]s *[[Devil-Linux]] â for services such as firewall/router (and many others), no graphical interface, can run from CD or USB *[[dyne:bolic]] â for multimedia production (especially for media activists, artists and creatives) *[[EnGarde Secure Linux]] â a highly-secure Linux based on [[SE Linux]] *[[FaunOS]] â a portable, fully integrated Linux distribution based on [[Arch Linux]], which can run from a USB Flash Drive or a DVD *[[GeeXboX]] â a self-contained [[Home theater PC|media center]] suite based on [[Linux]] and [[MPlayer]] * [[GoboLinux]] â an alternative Linux distribution. Its most salient feature is its reorganization of the filesystem hierarchy. Under GoboLinux, each program has its own subdirectory tree. *[[Lightweight Portable Security]] - developed and publicly distributed by the [[United States Department of Defense]]âs Software Protection Initiative to serve as a [[Secure End Node (network)|Secure End Node]] *[[Linux From Scratch|Linux From Scratch Live CD]] â used as a starting point for a Linux From Scratch installation *[[Puppy Linux]] â installable Live CD, very small *[[SliTaz GNU/Linux]] â installable Live CD, one of the smallest available with good feature set *[[Tiny Core Linux]] â based on Linux 2.6 kernel, [[BusyBox]], [[Tiny X]], [[Fltk]], and [[Flwm]], begins at 10 MB *[[XBMC Live]] â a self-contained [[Home theater PC|media center]] suite based on [[Embedded Linux]] and [[XBMC Media Center]]
== OpenSolaris-based ==
Systems based on the former open source "OS/net Nevada" or ONNV open source project by Sun Microsystems.
=== [[OpenSolaris|OpenSolaris-based]] === *[[OpenSolaris]] â the former official distribution supported by Sun Microsystems based on ONNV and some closed source parts *[[BeleniX]] â full LiveCD and LiveUSB distribution (moving to Illumos?) *[[MilaX]] small opensolaris based LiveCD and LiveUSB *[https://sites.google.com/site/eonstorage/ EON] a live image [[NAS]] solution based on Solaris Express Community Edition (SXCE) OS, codenamed "Nevada".
=== [http://developer.berlios.de/projects/schillix%2don/ SchilliX-ON-based] === [http://developer.berlios.de/projects/schillix%2don/ Schillix-ON] is a fork of the former OpenSolaris ONNV to base the continued the development of SchilliX upon. * [[SchilliX]] started as the first [[OpenSolaris]] Live CD distribution.
=== [[Illumos|Illumos-based]] === [http://www.illumos.org/ Illumos] is a fork of the former OpenSolaris ONNV aiming to further develop the ONNV and replacing the closed source parts while remaining binary compatible. The [http://openindiana.org Openindiana] distribution and the products of a few companies are based upon Illumos: *[[Nexenta OS]] â combines the GNU userland with the OpenSolaris kernel. *[[OpenIndiana]] - since OpenIndiana 151a based on Illumos *[http://smartos.org/ SmartOS] - Illumos based LiveCD from [[Joyent]] *[http://www.stormos.org StormOS] - A [http://www.nexenta.org/ Nexenta Core] based Live CD distribution
== GNU-based ==<!-- This section is linked from [[Debian GNU/Hurd]] --> * [[Arch Hurd]] A live CD of [[Arch Linux]] with the GNU Hurd as its kernel. * [[Superunprivileged.org]] Live CD - A live CD based on [[GNU Hurd]].
== Mac OS X-based == * [[BootCD]] from Charlessoft<ref>[http://www.charlessoft.com/ www.charlessoft.com]</ref> for [[Mac OS X]] up to 10.3 (including [[PowerPC]] Macintosh) * [[DasBoot]] by [[SubRosaSoft.com Inc.]] * [[OSx86]]<ref>[http://wiki.osx86project.org/wiki/index.php/ OSx86 Live CD]</ref> ([[x86]] only)
== Microsoft Windows-based == *Microsoft [[Windows Preinstallation Environment]]
Microsoft representatives have described third-party efforts at producing Windows-based Live CDs as âimproperly licensedâ uses of Windows, unless you use it solely to rescue your own, properly licensed Installation. However, [[Nu2 Productions]] believes the use of BartPE is legal provided that one Windows license is purchased for each BartPE CD, and the Windows license is used for nothing else.<ref> {{cite web |url=http://www.nu2.nu/pebuilder/licensing/ |title=Licensing issues |publisher=Nu2 Productions |accessdate=2006-12-31 }}</ref>
*[[BartPE]] (Windows XP/2003) â allows the creation of a bootable CD from Windows-install files *[[Reatogo-X-PE]] â based on BartPE *[[TeutonPE]] â based on BartPE *[[Ultimate Boot CD for Windows]] (UBCD4Win)-a BartPE based Live CD with lots of recovery/system tools. *[[VistaPE]] â a Live CD version for Windows Vista *[[WinBuilder]] (Windows 2000/XP/2003/Vista) â allows the creation of a bootable CD from Windows-install files *[[Windows PE]] (Windows 7) - the official tool from [[Microsoft]] to create a bootable image based on the Windows 7 kernel. It is part of the [[Windows Automated Installation Kit]] 3.0. *[[Windows PE]]- Free eScan Rescue Disk.
== DOS-based == *[[FreeDOS]] - the official "Full CD" 1.0 release includes a Live CD portion *[http://www.ultimatebootcd.com/ Ultimate Boot CD] (UBCD)
== Other operating systems == *[[AmigaOS 4]] â installable Live CD which also can be used independently from any existing OS installations. *[[AROS]] â offers Live CD for download on the project page *[[BeOS]] â all BeOS discs can be run in Live CD mode, although PowerPC versions need to be kickstarted from [[Mac OS 8]] *[[Haiku (operating system)|Haiku]] â Haiku is a free and open source operating system compatible with [[BeOS]] running on Intel [[x86]] platforms instead of PowerPC. *[[Hiren's BootCD]] *[[Minix]] *[[MorphOS]] â installable Live CD which can be also used as independent from any existing MorphOS installations. *[[OpenVMS]] â installable Live CD *[[Ecomstation|OS/2 Ecomstation Demo]] *[[Plan 9 from Bell Labs]] â Plan 9 has a Live CD, which is also its install CD (and the installer is a shell script). *[[QNX]] *[[ReactOS]] *[[SkyOS]] *[[Syllable Desktop (operating system)|Syllable Desktop]] Live CD
== See also == *[[List of tools to create Live USB systems]] *[[Windows To Go]]
